com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.io

Class IncrementingFileCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.westonpace.jayvee.workflow.StandardWorker
      • com.github.westonpace.jayvee.image.io.IncrementingFileCreator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Worker

    public class IncrementingFileCreator
extends StandardWorker
    Creates output streams to files in a given directory by incrementing a counter. To get filenames it simply takes the output directory a suffix, and a prefix and increments an index creating: ${directory}/${prefix}${index}${suffix} The file creator does not append any special characters so if you want your file to have an extension make sure to include a . in the suffix. (e.g. ".png")

    • Field Detail

      • generatedOutputStreams

        public Sink<OutputStream> generatedOutputStreams

        Receives the output streams generated by the directory writer.

        Those output streams are references to an active file handle and should not be shared or unexpected behavior will likely result.

    • Method Detail

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(String directoryName)
        Sets the directory the output files will be placed in. The path should probably be absolute for maximum portability. Relative paths will be interpreted relative to the location of the working directory when the main was executed.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - A path to a directory to place output files.

      • setPrefix

        public void setPrefix(String prefix)
        Sets the prefix to place before the index. For example, "image-"
        Parameters:
        prefix - The ${prefix} part of ${prefix}${index}${suffix}

      • setSuffix

        public void setSuffix(String suffix)
        Sets the suffix to place after the index. For example, ".png"
        Parameters:
        suffix - The ${suffix} part of ${prefix}${index}${suffix}

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Worker
        Initializes the worker. This will be called once all sources and sinks have been connected and all parameters have been set.
